history.content:
"I heard that upper division cs classes tends to remove people from the waitlist at the end of phase 1."
Not sure where you heard this, but I've never heard of this happening. You shouldn't be removed for trying to enrol in phase 1

We haven't removed people from the waitlist at the end of phase 1 since 2017.

Since then we tell people to use phase 1 units to join the wait list for classes that are important to you - you will remain 'stuck' on the waitlist until the adjustment period begins and the reserve capacities are released. At that time, any open seats will be filled solely based on the wait list position. So, the sooner you join the WL, the better change you give yourself later to get into the class.

You can learn more about the CS enrollment policies here.

I am in my last semester of lower div classes for the cs major, and if everything goes well, I'll probably be able to declare after the semester. However, I heard that upper division cs classes tends to remove people from the waitlist at the end of phase 1. Is it still advisable for me to try to enroll in cs classes in phase 1?
history.subject: Upper Div Phase 1 as CS Intended?
